gasoline in bulk for use by the City for municipal purposes.
4.39 (85-03B) No mechanical repairs of any kind shall be permitted on the
premises of a gasoline and oil filling station or service station unless a Special Use
Permit is issued under Section 2A and unless such station shall be licensed as a
mechanical garage and shall comply with all requirements and restrictions pertaining
thereto. (85-03B)
4.4 Definitions pertaining to mechanical garages:
(a) Open Bay shall mean a work area with a permanent roof of a design
and construction permitted by the ordinances of the City and paved with a load bearing
floor of concrete or asphalt. Open bays are permitted on the sides or rear of buildings.
(b) Rear work area shall mean a work area with paved load bearing floor
of concrete or asphalt and are permitted in the rear of buildings.
(c) Major automotive repair shall mean repairs which require the
disassembly or removal of any of the following: engine, motor, transmission, rear end,
drive shaft, radiator, brakes, master cylinder, wheel cylinders, axles, or other major
operating components.
(d) Minor automotive repairs shall mean all repairs not defined above as
major automotive repairs and shall include the replacement of compact components
such as distributors, starter motors, generators and the like, where disassembly of other
components is not required.
4.41 No major automotive repairs as herein defined shall be permitted
except in an enclosed building, open bays, and in rear work areas; provided, that no
major automotive repairs shall be allowed in rear work areas unless there is a five (5)
foot wall between said area and premises abutting or across the street from any
property which is zoned for any use other than
4.42 No automotive vehicle which is damaged or wrecked and unable to
operate lawfully under its own power shall be permitted upon, or stored upon the
premises of any gasoline filling station, service station, or mechanical garage, except in
a closed bay, or within an enclosed building, or within a completely enclosed walled
area with walls not less than five (5) feet in height.
4.43 (85-03B) No gasoline filling station, service station, or mechanical
garage shall operate as an automotive paint and body shop unless a Special Use
Permit is issued pursuant to Section 2A of this ordinance, and unless licensed as such
and complies with all legal regulations pertaining thereto.
4.44 No reconstruction, rebuilding or repair of body, fenders, chassis or
other non-operating components of automotive vehicles commonly known as body and
fender work shall be permitted unless a Special Use Permit is issued pursuant to
Section 2A of this Ordinance, and except in a duly licensed automotive paint and body
shop, and no such work shall be permitted except within an enclosed building. No
painting of automotive vehicles or components thereof shall be permitted except in an
automotive paint and body shop and which has complied with all regulations of the City,
Metropolitan Dade County, and the State of Florida, pertaining thereto. No automotive
vehicle which is damaged or wrecked and unable to operate lawfully under its own
power shall be permitted upon the premises of any automotive paint and body shop
except within a building or within a completely enclosed walled area with walls not less
than five (5) feet in height. (85-03B)
4.45 In "C" Use Districts, outdoor storage shall be permitted to the rear of
the building provided that such storage area shall be enclosed on all sides not abutting
a building with a solid or louvered masonry wall not less than five (5) feet in height, nor
more than eight (8) feet. When such wall abuts residential or apartment use district
height of wall shall comply with the requirements of Section 4.33 hereof. All openings in
such walls shall have a gate of equal height to the wall and shall be solid in
construction. Materials stored shall not extend above the height of such wall.
Section 4A. GENERAL REGULATIONS COMMON TO R-1", R-2", A AND C
USE DISTRICTS
4A.l No boat exceeding 23 feet in length, as determined by manufacturers
specifications for O.A.L., overall length, shall be stored in "R-l" or "R-2" districts. No
boat shall be stored in an A use District. No boat shall be stored in a C Use District,
except when a properly licensed business is authorized to sell or maintain boats.
Boats not exceeding 23 feet in length may be stored by occupants of premises located
within R-1" and R-2" Use Districts upon the following conditions:
(a) No boats shall be stored in the front yard setback area or in front of the
front line of the principal structure. No boats shall be stored within the exterior side yard
setback of corner lots or between the exterior side yard setback and the principal
structure. Boats may be stored in the side yard setback area, interior side yard setback
area of corner lots, rear yard setback area and other buildable areas of the property not
previously described herein. The place of storage shall not be nearer than three (3')
feet from rear property line.
(b) When a non-conforming use permit is granted, the place of storage
shall not be nearer than five (5) feet from exterior side lot line of corner lots. All boats
and trailers, if stored in front of the front building line, must be stored or parked
lengthwise perpendicular to the front lot line, except where driveways on corner lots
abut a side street, equipment shall be stored perpendicular to such side street, and no
portion of any equipment may extend over the sidewalk or public right-of-way.
Equipment may be stored on circular drives provided no portion thereof may extend
over the sidewalk or public right-of-way.
(c) No more than one boat may be stored for each dwelling unit in "R-1"
and "R-2" districts.
(d) Boats, trailers, and area of storage shall be kept in an orderly condition
and loose articles of equipment shall be kept within the boat. Repairs of boats and
equipment shall be done in an orderly manner so as not to constitute a nuisance, and
loose parts must be stored within the boat or other enclosed storage area except during
the actual performance of repairs.
(e) Boats shall be stored upon a boat trailer except that boats not
exceeding 12 feet in length and commonly known as "car top" boats may be stored
without a trailer.
(f) Boats and trailers shall be operable at all times.
(g) During hurricane or high wind warnings such equipment shall be so
secured so that it will not be a hazard or menace during high winds or hurricane.
(h) No resident of the City shall be allowed to store in their property, in which
they are residing, any boat or trailer, described within this section, which is owned by a
third party not residing in the real property where said vehicle or equipment is stored or
parked.
4A.2 In "R-1" and "R-2" Use Districts recreational and camping equipment in the
form of travel and camping trailers, truck trailers and motor travel homes, designed and
used as temporary living quarters for recreation, camping or travel use, may be parked
upon the premises by occupants thereof upon the following conditions:
(a) No more than one such unit of equipment shall be parked for each
dwelling unit in "R-1" and "R-2" districts.
(b) Such parking shall be limited to equipment owned or leased by the
occupant-owner or occupant-lessee of the site concerned, or owned or leased by a
bona fide house guest of the occupant-owner or occupant-lessee of the site concerned,
with the parking of such equipment by guest not to exceed 14 days.
(c) The location for such parked equipment shall be the same as area
outlined in Section 4A.1 (a) and (b).
(d) Such equipment and the area of parking shall be kept in an orderly
condition and loose articles of equipment shall be kept within the unit and the equipment
shall be in usable condition at all times.
(e) Such equipment shall be operable at all times.
(f) No major repairs or overhaul work on such equipment shall be made
or performed on the site. Major repairs or overhaul work shall 'mean repairs which
require the disassembly or removal of any of the follow: engine, motor, transmission,
rear end, drive shaft, radiator, brakes, master cylinder, wheel cylinders, axles, or other
major operating components, and the removal or replacement of walls or outer shell of
such equipment. Any other work performed shall be done in an orderly manner so as
not to constitute a nuisance and loose parts and materials must be stored in the unit or
other enclosed storage area except during actual performance of repairs.
(g) When parked on the site, such equipment shall not be used for living
or sleeping quarters, or for housekeeping or storage purposes and shall not have
attached thereto any service connection lines, except as may periodically be required to
maintain the equipment and appliances.
(h) Such equipment shall not exceed the maximum length, width, height
and weight permitted under applicable provisions of the Motor Vehicle Laws of the State
of Florida; provided, however, the maximum length shall not exceed 23 feet and the
maximum height shall not exceed 11 feet from ground.
(i) During hurricane or high wind warnings such equipment shall be so
secured so that it will not be a hazard or menace during high winds or hurricane.
(j) No recreational and camping equipment in the form of travel and camping
trailers, truck trailers and motor homes, designed and used as temporary living quarters
for recreation, camping or travel use, may be parked upon the premises within the A
and C Use Districts.
(k) No resident of the City shall be allowed to store in their property, in which
they are residing, any vehicles or equipment, described within this section, which is
owned by a third party not residing in the real property where said vehicle or equipment
is stored or parked.
4A.3 It shall be unlawful for any person to park any truck, trailer or other
commercial type vehicle in or upon any property public or private in an "R-1", "R-2" or
"A" Use District except in a completely enclosed garage; provided, however, that this
prohibition shall not apply in cases of loading or unloading such vehicles between the
hours of 7 o'clock a.m. and 7 o'clock p.m. of the same day and such loading or
unloading takes no more than four (4) hours. The four hour loading limitation shall not
apply to trucks in actual use during construction or repair of improvements upon such
property. Notwithstanding the foregoing, occupants of dwelling units within such use
districts when not in violation of other ordinances of the City may park not more than
one such vehicle per dwelling unit upon the premises provided such vehicle complies
with the following:
(a) Height shall not exceed 8 feet including ladders or other attachments
to the top of the vehicle.
(b) Width shall not exceed 6 feet 10 inches excluding mirrors.
(c) Overall length does not exceed 18 feet 6 inches.
(d) Open trucks shall not have load space exceeding 9 feet 6 inches in
length.
(e) Dual wheels are prohibited.
(f) More than two axles are prohibited.
Further provided, that all equipment or materials stored or carried upon or used in
connection therewith shall be stored in a neat, orderly manner so as not to be unsightly
or constitute a nuisance.
4A.4 (91-02) No utility shed shall be permitted in "All Use District,. In "R-1" and
"R-2" Use Districts a utility shed shall be permitted upon the following conditions:
(a) Only one utility shed shall be permitted per building site in "R-1" and "R-2"
Use Districts.
(b) Utility shed shall not exceed 12 feet in width, 12 feet in length, and 8 feet 6
inches (8"6") in height.
(c) Utility shed shall be constructed or installed in accordance with the
Metropolitan Dade County Building Code, known as South Florida Building Code.
(d) Utility shed may contain electrical and plumbing facilities except there
shall be no electrical or plumbing facilities or fixtures for bath room or kitchen use.
(e) Utility shed which is attached to the building shall not be attached to the
front of the building, and if located on the side of the building shall be concealed by
trees or shrubs so as not to be visible from the street. All utility sheds attached to
buildings shall conform to side setbacks and in no event shall be nearer than three feet
to the rear property line. Detached utility sheds may be installed only to the rear of
existing buildings and shall not be closer than three feet to the existing building. All
detached utility sheds shall be installed no nearer than three feet to the rear property
line and shall conform to side setbacks. Attached sheds shall be installed so that the
side adjacent to the building shall be flush with and contiguous to the wall of the building
to which it is attached. (91-02)
4A.5 In all "R-1", "R-2" and "A" Use Districts, an area or passageway not less
than three (3) feet in width on one side of the building from the front lot line to the rear
yard behind the building shall be kept open and unobstructed to enable City police,
firemen, garbage collectors, and other City officials and employees to have ready
access to the rear yard for the performance of their official duties. Such area or
passageway shall be kept free of trees, shrubs, and trash, and all other obstructions.
Section 5. OFF STREET PARKING, LOADING AND UNLOADING REQUIREMENTS
5.1. The off-street parking, loading and unloading requirements shall apply to all
new buildings or structures, or to any existing buildings or structures that may be
structurally altered or added to after the effective date of this Ordinance. Where a
change of use occurs, off-street parking requirements applying to the new use shall be
provided. Land used for off-street parking in conjunction with a business must be
included in the title description of the property upon which the business is situated and
shall not be disposed of separately from the business property.
5.2 The required off-street parking shall be determined in accordance with the
following table:
LAND USE OFF STREET PARKING
Minimum Number of Spaces
SINGLE FAMILY RESIDENCE One Space on premises.
DUPLEX AND APARTMENT One and one-half space on premises
for each dwelling unit of 2 bedrooms
or less and two spaces on premises
for each dwelling unit of 3 bedrooms
or more.
MOTELS AND HOTELS One space on premises for
each unit.
RETAIL BUSINESS, COMMERCIAL One space for each 300 square feet
or fraction thereof of gross floor
area.
CHURCHES, THEATERS, AUDITORIUMS One space for each 4 AND SIMILAR
PLACES OF PUBLIC seats or fraction of 4 ASSEMBLY,
RESTAURANTS AND PUBLIC seats.
DINING ROOMS
OFFICE BUILDINGS, CLINICS, 6 spaces minimum plus one
HOSPITALS, WELFARE INSTITUTIONS space for each 300 square
feet or fraction thereof
of gross floor area over
1800 square feet.
Where more than one of the uses specified above is operated upon a tract of land or
within a building, sufficient parking spaces on premises as set forth herein shall be
required for each such use.
5.2A Where a building contains two or more separate self-contained units or
stores, each with separate and private entrances, the required off-street parking shall be
three parking spaces per each separate unit or store or one parking space for each 200
square feet or fraction thereof of gross floor area whichever shall require the greater
number of parking spaces.
Where two or more businesses under separate ownership are operated in a
building under one roof or are not contained in separate self-contained units or stores
with separate and private entrances, the required off-street parking shall be four parking
spaces per each business unit or one parking space for each 200 square feet or fraction
thereof of gross floor area occupied by each business, whichever shall require the
greater number of parking spaces.
(82-05) No additional parking shall be required for coffee bars located within
merchandizing establishments provided that such establishments have sufficient offstreet
parking as provided in this ordinance. (82-05)
5.3 On the same premises with every structure erected and occupied for storage
goods display, department store, wholesale store, market, hotel, laundry, dry cleaning,
or other uses similarly involving the receipt or distribution by vehicles, of materials or
merchandise, there shall be provided and maintained on the lot, adequate space for
standing, loading and unloading services in order to avoid undue interference with
public use of streets or alleys. Such space shall include a minimum of a 10-foot by 25-
foot loading space for every 5000 square feet or fraction thereof of the gross building
area used for above mentioned purposes.
5.3A It shall be unlawful to park or permit to be parked any trailer, truck, or van
upon property within the City designated for off-street parking for a period of more than
twenty-four (24) hours; and it is unlawful to use any such trailer, truck, or van for storage
purposes on such property for a period of more than twenty-four (24) hours. Provided,
however, that this section shall not apply to parking permitted under Sections 4A.1, 4A.2
and 4A.3 of Ordinance 282.
5.4 All plans submitted with an application for a building permit shall show
thereon the parking spaces, off-street loading and unloading areas where applicable,
together with the means for ingress and egress from streets or alleys to said off-street
parking or off-street loading and unloading. The maximum width of any driveway shall
be forty (40) feet, and the minimum distance between adjacent driveways shall be
fifteen (15) feet.
5.5 All off-street parking, off-street loading and unloading areas, together with
the means of ingress and egress from streets or alleys to said off-street parking or for
off-street loading and unloading areas, required by this ordinance shall be paved in
accordance with the specifications for such paving from time to time established by the
City of West Miami, and necessary drainage as determined by the City Engineer, shall
be provided for all such paved off-street parking. All plans submitted with an application
for building permit which are required to show off-street parking shall show therein the
paved areas and the location and type of drainage to be installed. In single family
residences or duplexes the use of concrete ribbons shall be permitted instead of paving,
and no drainage for the parking area need be provided.
5.6 Plans for off-street parking in "C" and "All Use Districts shall not provide for
egress to any street which would require vehicles to back onto such street.
5.7 Any parking areas or loading areas within the zoned street right-of-way shall
not be considered in computing the parking spaces or loading areas required under the
terms of this ordinance.
5.8 Where parking spaces head into and abut a sidewalk the paved 20 feet
length of the parking space shall be curbed at 17 feet in order to prevent extension of
the vehicle over the sidewalk.
5.9 All interior driveways and ingress and egress driveways shall be at least 23
feet wide between paved parking spaces.
Section 6. NON-CONFORMING USE
6.1 The lawful use of land existing at the time of the passage of this ordinance or
amendment thereto, although such use does not conform to the provisions hereof, may
be continued; but if such non-conforming use is discontinued for a period of six (6)
months such: non-conforming use shall not be re-established and any further use of the
land shall be in conformity with the provisions of this ordinance.
6.2 If no structural changes are made, except those required by 'the safety of the
building, a non-conforming use may be changed to another non-conforming use of a
higher restricted classification. For purposes of this ordinance, "R-1" use shall be
considered as having the highest restricted classification and "C" use shall be
considered as having the lowest restricted classification.
6.3 (Reserved)
6.4 Nothing in this Ordinance shall prevent the restoration of a building in the
non-conforming classification damaged by fire, explosion or other casualty to not more
than sixty percent (60%) of its reasonable value, and the continuance of such nonconforming
use after restoration.
6.5 A non-conforming use that becomes a nuisance to the surrounding property,
by reason of noxious odors, unsightly appearance, lack of maintenance or for other
reasons, and when in the opinion of the City Council such property does not conform to
provisions of this ordinance, shall be discontinued after public hearing upon due notice
to the owner thereof.
6.6 After the effective date of this ordinance, trailer parks shall not be reestablished.
Section 7. GENERAL REGULATIONS COMMON TO ALL USE DISTRICTS
7.1 Utility Easements.
7.11 Two and one-half feet (2-1/2') of the rear of each lot shall be reserved as a
utility easement and all utility company employees and garbage collection employees
shall be given free access thereto. Where the side of a lot abuts the rear of adjacent
lots, two and one-half feet (2-1/2') of the abutting side shall also be reserved as a utility
easement. Provided, however, that the utility easement for the tract consisting of lots
30-35 inclusive TAMIAMI LAWNS, Plat Book 8, Page 28, Public Records of Dade
County, Florida, shall not consist of the rear two and one half feet (2-1/2') of such lots,
but shall consist of the North five feet (N.5') of lots 30 and 35 so long as all of said six
lots are developed and used as a single tract.
7.12 Such utility easement may be used for yard purposes or for off-street
parking purposes, and hedges and ornamental shrubs may be placed therein, but the
owner of the premises shall bear full responsibility for their protection and shall assume
all costs of repair, removal or replacement of such hedges, ornamental shrubs in the
event their removal is required for the installation, repair, removal or replacement or
inspection of utilities in said easement.
7.13 No trees, rock wall or concrete block wall or fences shall be installed or
constructed in said utility easement.
7.2 Walls, Fences & Hedges.
7.21 Painted concrete block walls, stone walls and wire fences may be erected.
Where a wire fence abuts the utility easement it shall contain at least one gate for
ingress and egress to the easement; and all such gates shall not be locked, fastened or
otherwise obstructed in any manner that will prevent access, ingress or egress to such
easement by any properly authorized City employee or public utility employee.
7.22 (89-13) Walls, fences and hedges, and all living vegetation when used as a
fence shall not exceed six feet (6') in height above finished grade in residential uses
except that such walls, hedges and fences shall not exceed four feet (4') in height upon
that portion of the property between the zoned setback line and abutting streets,
provided, however, walls, fences, hedges and all living Vegetation when used as a
fence may exceed four feet (4') in height, but shall not exceed six feet (6') in height
when located behind the principal structure within the exterior side setback of a corner
lot in the following configuration as illustrated in "figure All below: (89-13)
7.23 In "C" Use Districts, walls, fences and hedges between properties which
abut or face one another, and both of which are zoned "C" Use, shall not exceed eight
feet in height.
7.24 (81-06) No fence or wall shall be constructed with barbed wire except that in
"C" Use Districts barbed wire may be used on top of fences, provided, that the bottom
or lower stand or barbed wire shall not be less than seven feet (7') above ground level.
No fence or wall may be constructed in such a manner that pieces of glass or other
material protrude there from in such a manner as to be dangerous or hazardous to
persons coming into contact therewith. Electrically charged fences are not permitted in
the City. (81-06)
7.3 Projections Beyond the Building Lines
7.31 Steps, platforms, terraces, flower bins, fountains, barbecues or other similar
features less than forty-eight inches (48") in height above finished grade may extend
beyond the building line. Open type metal fire escapes may project forty-eight inches
(48") beyond the building line, provided the bottom rung shall be counter-balanced
and when the bottom rung is up, there will be at least nine feet (9') clear headroom
below it. The bottom rung shall be adjacent to the building and so place, that when
down, there will be at least twenty-eight inches (28") of unobstructed passage
between it and the adjacent property line.
7.4 Satellite Earth Station (85-04)
7.41Definition: A dish shaped antenna designed to receive television broadcasts
related by microwave signals from earth-orbiter communication satellites, including a
low-noise amplifier (INA) and a coaxial cable for the purpose of carrying signals to the
interior of a building.
7.42 (86-06) A satellite earth station, restricted to the sole purpose of receiving and
amplifying microwave signals, for television reception shall be permitted as an auxiliary
use to "R", "A" or "C" Use District subject to approval of application by the Planning and
Zoning Board and requirements, conditions and restrictions:
A. That plans of such antenna shall be submitted with each application for a
Building Permit, which shall include: (1) original and five (5) copies of site plan indicating
the height, diameter, color, location, setbacks, foundation details, landscaping and
screening; (2) color samples of antenna; (3) 3" x 5" photographs or greater or Polaroid
pictures showing three (3) views as follows:
(a) general area of installation
(b) view of adjacent properties
(c) view of site from street
B. That such Satellite Earth Station shall be subject to the following[ standards,
safeguards, conditions and criteria:
1. Location and Setbacks:
(a) In "R-1" and "R-2" Use Districts, only groundmounted antennas shall
be permitted and such antennas shall be located in the rear of the property
behind the rear line of the principal structure and no part of said antenna shall
extend beyond the exiting sides of said structure nor shall any part or portion
of said antenna be able to be within 7.5 feet of any rear lot line.
(b) No installation of antennas in R-1 and R-2 Use Districts unless there is
an existing principal structure being used or intended to be used as a
residence.
(c) In "A" or "C" Use Districts, roof-mounted antennas shall be permitted,
provided, however, that such antennas shall be screened from ground view
by a parapet or some other type masonry wall or screening. The minimum
height and design of such parapet, wall or screening shall be subject to
approval by the Planning and Zoning Board.
(d) Ground-mounted antennas shall also be permitted in "A" and "C" Use
Districts subject to the applicable provisions of this section relating thereto.
(e) No antennas may be mounted in front of any existing principal
structure.
(f) No antennas may be mounted that would infringe or obstruct
any required off-street parking.
(g) If any "C" Use District abuts and "R" or "All Use District, the antenna
shall not be installed closer than 7.5 feet of the property line of such abutting
"R" or "A" Use.
(h) In no case shall such Satellite Earth Station be located closer to the
front or side street of a lot or building site than the main or principal building.
(i) Where such Satellite Earth Station is located on a building site which is
fronting upon two or more streets, the antenna shall maintain the same
setback as required for each such street.
2. Landscaping. Ground-mounted antennas shall be shielded or screened
from ground view from any public right-of-way by landscaping as shall be
approved by the Planning and Zoning Board.
3. Diameter. The diameter of such antenna shall not exceed the following:
(a) In "R" Use Districts - twelve (12) feet
(b) In "A" and "C" Use Districts-fifteen (15) feet
4. Height.
(a) Ground-mounted antennas shall be limited to a maximum height of
seventeen and one-half (17-1/2) feet above grade in "R" Use Districts, and a
maximum height of seventeen and one-half (17-1/2) feet above the average
height of the roof in "A" or "C" Use Districts. (b) Roof-mounted antennas in
"A" or "C" Use Use Districts shall be limited to a maximum height of
seventeen and one-half (17-1/2) feet above the height of the roof.
(c) Definition of the "height" of a roof in (a) and
(b) above is as follows:
For roofs with slopes greater than one-quarter
(1/4) inch per foot the roof height is defined as the average of the sum of the
high and low point. For flat roof height is defined as the lowest point of the
finished roof.
5. Ground Coverage. The ground coverage of the
base of such antennas shall be counted in computing the ground coverage for
auxiliary and accessory use structures located upon the building site.
6. Color. Such satellite earth stations and their appurtenances shall be
neutral in color and, to the extent possible, shall be compatible with the appearance and
character of the neighborhood.
7. Number Permitted. only one satellite earth station shall. be allowed for
each principal building located in an "R", "A" or "C" Use District.
8. Installation:
(a) The installation or modification of a satellite earth station shall be in
accordance with all applicable construction and safety codes and procedures
of all Federal, State, County and municipal laws, ordinances, rules and
regulations, and shall meet the requirements of the South Florida Building
Code and any amendments thereof.
9. Maintenance. Such satellite earth stations, appurtenances,
landscaping and screening shall be kept and maintained in good condition at all times.
(86-06)
Section 8. BUILDING TYPE (87-20)
8.1(a) All buildings shall be constructed as specified
in the Metropolitan Dade County Building code and the South
Florida Building Code, as amended from time to time.
(b) Where wood frame construction is utilized for the principal building or
additions thereto, such type of building shall be constructed as follows:
1. 2"x 4" wood studs 16" on center with metal lath and 3/4"
exterior cement plaster(k) on each side. Lath attached with 6d
common nails 7" on center driven to ill minimum penetration and bent
over. Plaster mix 1:2 scratch coat and 1:3 brown coat, by weight,
cement to sand
2. In addition, approved Foam Plastic shall be installed within the
exterior portion of the wall. (87-20)
Section 9. DRIVEWAYS
9.l Any building or premises which includes a garage, carport or parking area
shall be provided with a paved flared driveway approach. Such approach shall be
constructed in accordance with the Standard Specifications of the City.
Section 10. SIDEWALKS
10.1 All buildings shall be provided with a sidewalk adjacent to the zoned
street line constructed in accordance with the Standard Specifications of the City. The
City Engineer shall determine usability of any existing walk.
Section 11. SWIMMING POOLS
11.1 Plans and Specifications. Applications for installation of swimming
pools shall be accompanied by full and complete plans and specifications, in duplicate,
for such proposed work. Plans and Specifications shall bear the seal of a Florida
Registered Engineer, thereby certifying structural electrical and mechanical design.
11.2 Supply and Disposal of Pool Water. Supply wells and disposal wells
shall meet the requirements of the Metropolitan Dade County Code. Drainage of
swimming pools may be to a soakage pit and/or lawn irrigation, subject to the approval
of the Building Department. In no case shall pool waste water be allowed to flow
beyond property line.
11.3 Setbacks. Setbacks (measured to the inside face of the pool wall)
shall be a minimum of ten feet (10') from the side and rear property line, and twenty-five
feet (25') from the front property line. Screened enclosures used in conjunction with
pools shall not be less than 7.5' from side and rear property lines whether interior or
facing streets, and not less than twenty-five feet (25') from front property line.
11.4 Additional Requirements. For additional requirements for swimming
pools see Chapter 21 of the Code of the City of West Miami.
Section 12. LIVESTOCK, POULTRY, PETS ETC.
12.1 Any livestock such as horses, ponies, cows, pigs, chickens, ducks,
geese or other kinds of livestock, fowl and poultry, shall not be permitted to be kept on
any premises in the City of West Miami. For additional restrictions see Chapter 4,
Animals and Fowl, of the Code of the City of West Miami.
Section 13. MAINTENANCE OF PROPERTY
13.l No occupied or vacant lots shall be permitted to become overgrown in such a
manner as to become unsightly or possible breeding places for insects, vermin, rodents
or reptiles or in any other way become detrimental to public health, safety and welfare.
For additional requirements, see Ordinance 281 and Chapter 10 of the Code of the City
of West Miami.
Section 14. SIGNS
14.1 Definitions. Unless the context clearly shall require otherwise, the
terms used herein shall have the following meanings, the singular shall include the
plural and the gender shall be construed to be masculine, feminine or neuter.
(a) Sign Erector: Any person engaged in the construction, reconstruction, or
erection of any sign having a structural frame or using electric power or requiring a
scaffold for erection or application.
(b) Sign Writer: Any person engaged in the painting or application of signs on
windows, doors, walls, awnings, or elsewhere where such signs involve no structural
framework or electric power.
(c) Person: Any individual, association, firm, corporation, partnership, joint
venture, or other legal entity. (d) Sign: Any out-of-door display or characters, letters,
illustrations, or ornamentations including the complete structure on which any such
characters, letters, illustrations, or ornamentations are supported or applied; except that
guys and their anchorages and the poles of pole signs shall not be considered part of a
sign.
(e) Banner Signs: Any sign having the characters, letters, illustrations, or
ornamentations applied to cloth, paper or fabric.
(f) Flat signs: A sign erected parallel to the face of the outside wall of building
and supported throughout by such wall and shall include a sign applied flat against wall
or painted on such outside wall.
(g) Horizontal Projecting Sign: A sign projecting from the outside wall of a
building the greater dimension of which is along the horizontal projection.
(h) Vertical Projecting Sign: A sign projecting from the outside wall of a building,
the vertical dimension of which equals or exceeds its horizontal dimension.
(i) Roof Sign: A sign supported by an independent structure fastened to or
supported by the roof of a building.
(j) Pole Sign: A sign supported by one or more poles and which is wholly or
partially independent of a building. Pole shall include post, column, pyramid or other
extension from ground level, regardless of the material from which made. (See: Also
Detached Sign.)
(k) Revolving Sign: A sign supported by one or more poles and which is wholly or
partially independent of a building, and all or any part thereof turns or revolves in a
circle or a part of a circle then returning to its original position. Pole shall include post,
column, pyramid or other extension from ground level regardless of the material from
which made. No revolving sign shall be permitted to make more than ten (10) complete
revolutions per minute or more than ten (10) moving sequences per minute if less than
a complete revolution. Only constant illumination shall be permitted in such signs and
no flashing, sparkling, flow or any other intermittent illumination shall be permitted. Such
signs shall not exceed thirty-five (35) square feet except that where the lot frontage
exceeds fifty (50) feet the sign may contain an additional one half (1/2) square foot for
each additional foot of frontage up to a maximum of sixty (60) square feet.
(1) Marquee Sign: A sign attached to or hanging from
a marquee.
(m) Marquee: A structure projecting from and supported by a building and having
an independent roof and drainage provisions, customarily erected over a doorway as a
protection against the weather.
(n) Billboard Sign: A sign advertising a product or service, including
entertainment or candidacy, which product or service is not available for sale or
performance at the place where the sign is located.
(o) Snipe Sign: A sign, usually small, of any material including, but not limited to,
paper, cardboard, wood or metal attached to any object and having no application to the
premises where located.
(p) Permitee: The person in possession or having the beneficial use of property
upon which a sign is located for which a permit is required.
(q) Owner: The person owning the fee simple title to the property upon which a
sign is located, which sign requires a permit hereunder.
(r) Pylon: A vertical or horizontal extension of any face of a building constituting
an integral part of the building structure.
(s) Pylon Sign: A flat sign attached to or painted on the face of a pylon.
(t) Cantilever Sign: A sign mounted on a cantilever which does not extend
beyond the cantilever and does not extend more than 18" above the top of the building
wall.
(u) Cantilever: A horizontal projection of a building
supported wholly by the building.
(v) Detached Sign: A sign affixed to the ground, no
part of which is attached to or on a building.
(w) Flashing Sign: Defined as any sign wherein all or
any part thereof turns on and off in any sequence, such sequence
shall be limited to no more than forty times per minute. The sequence count shall
include each separate time any part of the sign turns on and off.
(x) Sparkling Sign: Any sign which is illuminated by incandescent bulbs which
brighten and dim so as to give the appearance of no definite pattern, but, however,
gives the appearance of sparkle.
(y) Flowing Sign: A sign illuminated by incandescent bulbs which brighten and
dim in a pattern so as to give the appearance of movement of light.
(z) Directional Flow Sign: Neon illuminated sign which neon goes on and off so
as to create the illusion of starting from a point and continuing to a point and/or making
a circuit. Provided that no part of the sign may flash on or off more than 120 times per
minute, nor may it make its complete circle, and/or circuit, from beginning to end more
than the number of times as computed by dividing one-third into the number of times of
the flash of any of its component part or parts. (For example: A sign consisting of 75
flashing parts, each of which flashes 120 times per minute, portrays a figure moving
from the left side of the sign to the right side of the sign. The cycle of the figure in
moving from the left side of the sign to the right side of the sign would be limited to 40
times per minute - 1/3rd of 120).
(aa) Sign Area. That area within a line including the outer extremities of all
letters, figures, characters, and delineations, or within a line or background of the sign,
whichever line includes the larger area. The support for the sign background, whether it
be columns, a pylon, or a building or part thereof, shall not be included in the sign area.
only one side of a double-faced sign shall be included in a computation of sign area.
The area of a cylindrical sign shall be computed by multiplying one-half of the
circumference by the height of the sign.
14.2 It shall be unlawful for any person to erect, construct, reconstruct, or
to alter structurally any sign which fails to conform to the provisions of this ordinance
within the limits of the City of West Miami.
14.3 Sign Restrictions in Residential Districts. No sign will be allowed in
any "R" District within the City of West Miami except the following:
(a) Professional Signs; that is, a sign containing only the name and occupation of
the professional person occupying the premises upon which the sign is displayed, which
sign shall not exceed one square foot in size. Only one such sign shall be permitted for
each dwelling unit.
(b) Real Estate Signs; that is, a sign offering the sale or rental of the premises or
indicating actual construction only. Only one such sign shall be permitted upon the
premises and shall not exceed two feet (2') in height, and two feet (2') in width, except
that where the property faces more than one street one such sign shall be permitted for
each street frontage.
(c) Traffic and Directional Signs; that is, any sign deemed necessary for traffic
control or public safety by proper governmental authorities.
(d) Municipal Signs; that is, any sign placed upon municipal property by the
officers of the City.
14.4 Sign Restrictions in Multi-family Districts. No sign will be allowed in the
City of West Miami in any "A" District except the following type signs:
(a) Signs permitted in "R" Districts.
(b) Apartment houses, clubs, convalescent homes.
only one sign may be displayed on the premises advertising any apartment house, club,
or convalescent home which sign shall not exceed 24 square feet in area and may
contain only the name of the apartment house, club, or convalescent home; provided,
however, an apartment house or club may also display a sign not exceeding eight (8)
square feet in area indicating a vacancy or the availability of a dining room or cocktail
lounge.
(c) Signs denoting construction as provided in Section 14.5(c) and future
construction as provided in 14.7.
14.5 Sign Restrictions on Business or Commercial Property. It shall be
unlawful for any person to erect, construct or structurally alter any sign in an area zoned
for business or commercial uses except in connection with the advertising of the
building or property, or of a product or service sold, dispensed, or rendered on, in, or
from the premises on which the sign is located and unless such sign shall comply with
the restrictions herein contained.
(a) No sign shall be painted on or attached to the wall of any business building
which exceeds in size thirty percent (30%) of the total area of the wall upon which the
sign is placed or attached.
(b) No sign shall be placed on the side or at the rear of business property so as
to face abutting residential property or direct light or illumination upon such abutting
residential property.
(c) one sign not exceeding 60 square feet in area may be displayed during
construction on any business or apartment property while such construction is in
progress, which sign may set forth the following:
(1) Type of construction.
(2) Offer of sale or lease.
(3) Name, address, and phone number of contractor.
(4) Name, address, and phone number of architect.
(5) Name of owner.
(6) Name of broker, if any.
(7) Names of sub-contractors and suppliers of material.
(d) No sign shall be erected or constructed in such
manner as to obstruct any door, window, or fire escape of any building.
(e) No sign shall be erected closer to any overhead electrical conductor than five
feet (5') where the difference in potential between any two conductors or between any
one conductor and ground shall exceed 750 volts.
(f) The minimum distance from the bottom of pole or projecting signs shall be not
less than nine feet (9') above grade.
(g) No business establishment shall erect upon the premises occupied by such
business more than one of the following types of signs: (a) Pole Sign; (b) Projecting
Sign; (c) Roof Sign; (d) Cantilever Sign; (e) Detached Sign; provided, however, that
where more than one business is located in a single building only one pole sign may be
erected in front of such building notwithstanding the fact that more than one business
enterprise is operated upon such premises.
14.6 Certain Signs Permitted in "C" Use Districts: In addition to other signs
permitted in "C" Use Districts under this ordinance, revolving signs, sparkling signs,
flowing signs, and directional flow signs are permitted in "C" Use Districts subject to the
limitations of this Ordinance as to classification and size of and number of signs
permitted upon "C" Use District properties. All such signs shall be classified as to type
and construction as provided herein.
14.7 Miscellaneous Restrictions. The following restrictions shall be
imposed:
(a) Motels and hotels. No motel or hotel shall display any sign which shall
exceed in area the maximum prescribed for
each sign as follows:
Type of Sign Maximum Area
Detached Sign 50 square feet
Flat Sign or Cantilever Sign Marquee Sign 50 Square feet
Projecting Sign 50 Square feet
Pylon Sign 50 Square feet
No motel or hotel shall display any sign other than of the type above listed and only one
sign shall be permitted on the premises; except that signs not exceeding eight (8)
square feet in area may be displayed advertising "Vacancy", "Dining Room", and
"Cocktail Lounge". In addition,, one portable sign not exceeding 3 feet by 4 feet shall be
permitted on the premises.
(b) Signs denoting future construction. A sign advertising future construction, not
exceeding 40 square feet in area in districts zoned for business or 24 square feet in
area in districts zoned apartment, may be displayed no closer than fifteen feet (15') from
the front lot line and from property under different ownership, for a period not to exceed
60 days.
(c) Portable Signs.
(1) Portable signs shall not exceed four feet (4') in height and three feet
(3') in width, which dimensions shall include the support and framework thereon.
(2) Portable signs may contain advertising matter on both sides and must
contain the name and address of the owner of said sign, for the purpose of
identification. This information may be placed on the bottom or interior of an "A" type
sign, but must be located in such a place as can be readily located.
(3) Portable signs may not be illuminated or electrified in any way.
(4) Portable signs meeting these requirements shall be permitted within
the City of West Miami only on the basis of one (1) portable sign for each ground floor
business establishment hold a West Miami occupational license within "C" Use Districts,
provided, however, that where multiple licensees use a common entrance to the
premises as in the case of sub-lessees, they shall be considered for the purpose of this
ordinance collectively as a single business and only one (1) portable sign shall be
permitted.
(5) Portable signs as permitted by this section shall only be permitted
along the following streets:
S.W. 57 Avenue
S.W. 67 Avenue
S.W. 8th Street
S.W. 24th Street, also known as Coral Way,
and shall not be placed closer than forty (40) feet of the center line of S.W. 57th and
S.W. 67th Avenues, and closer than fiftyfive (55) feet of the center line of S.W. 8th
Street and S.W. 24th Street, also known as Coral Way, nor within any private or public
parking area, alley, easement or right-of-way, and must be removed from outdoors and
placed inside the business establishment during such hours as the establishment is
closed for business.
14.8 Sign Standards and Restrictions.
(a) No sign shall be suspended across any public
street, avenue, alley, or other public road.
(b) No sign shall be painted, posted, printed, nailed, or otherwise affixed to any
curb, sidewalk, tree, light standard, utility pole, hydrant, bridge or structure within the
right-of-way of any street, avenue, alley, or other public thoroughfare, within the limits of
the City of West Miami. Provided, however, this restriction shall not apply to any sign
not in violation of any of the provisions of this ordinance affixed to or suspended from
any awning or marquee.
(c) No sign shall be attached to or displayed on or from any wall, window, door,
gate, fence, or other structure in a district zoned for single family or two family
occupancy except as specifically authorized herein.
(d) No flat signs shall exceed 30% of the area of the wall to which it is affixed, nor
shall it project more than 12" from the face of the building by which it is supported and
no more than 4" air space between sign and building. No flat sign shall extend above
the parapet of the wall by which it is supported by more than 18" on any building having
a flat roof. No flat sign shall extend more than 18" above the eaves of a building having
a pitched roof. In computing the area of a flat sign upon the wall or other face of a
building, the area of doorways and windows shall be counted as part of the area of the
wall.
(e) No permit shall be issued for any sign which proposes to display any
obscene, indecent, or immoral matter. It shall be unlawful for any person to display
upon any wall or other advertising structure any matter which is obscene, indecent, or
immoral.
(f) Horizontal Projecting Signs. No horizontal projecting sign shall:
(1) Exceed 50 square feet of calculated area as determined by Subsection
14.2 hereof.
(2) Be erected so as to provide more than 12" of clear space between the
sign and the building from which it projects.
(3) Extend more than 6" from the building from which it projects.
(4) Extend above the parapet of a building with a
flat roof.
(5) Extend above the eaves of a building with a
pitched roof.
(6) Extend or project over any public right-of-way except above a marquee
or cantilever.
(7) Contain or utilize any flood lights, spot lights, or gooseneck light for
purposes of illumination.
(8) Be attached to or supported by a frame building or by the wooden
framework of any building if it shall exceed 10 square feet in projected area or 50
pounds in weight.
(g) Vertical Projecting Signs. No vertical projecting sign shall:
(1) Exceed 50 square feet of calculated area as determined by Subsection
14.2 hereof.
(2) Project more than 4 feet from the building by
which it is supported.
(3) Exceed 18' in height.
(4) Extend more than 5' above the parapet wall of
a building having a flat roof.
(5) Extend more than 5' above the eaves of a
building having a pitched roof.
(6) Extend over any public right-of-way except atop a marquee or cantilever.
(7) contain or utilize a flood light, spot light, or gooseneck light for
purposes of illumination.
(8) Be attached to or supported by a frame building or the wooden
framework of any building if it shall exceed 10 square feet in projected area or shall
exceed 50 pounds in weight.
(h) Roof Signs. No roof sign shall:
(1) Exceed 300 square feet of calculated area as determined by
Subsection 14.2 hereof.
(2) Exceed 20' in height above the surface of the roof.
(3) Be so constructed as to provide less than 6' of vertical clear space
between the roof and the lowest portion of the sign over more than 25% of its length
unless the sign shall be 10' or less in length and shall allow clear passage to all parts of
the roof and the height of which shall not exceed 3' above the roof line.
(4) Be erected or maintained so that the plane of the face of the sign shall
be within 5' of the plane of the outside wall in the direction in which the sign is faced or
in a manner permitting any part of the sign to project beyond the edge of the roof.
(i) No permit shall be issued for a horizontal or vertical projecting sign, or for a
roof sign, unless plans therefore shall bear the signature and seal of a registered Florida
professional engineer certifying to compliance by the sign with all of the applicable
provisions of the South Florida Building Code.
(j) No permit shall be granted for the erection, construction or reconstruction of a
roof sign in excess of one sign for each occupancy of the building covered by such roof
unless the building shall be erected on a corner lot, in which event one sign facing each
street may be authorized.
(k.) The outer edge of a pylon sign shall not project or extend beyond the pylon.
(l) Any sign mounted on the underside of a cantilever shall provide a minimum
clearance of 9' between the lowest portion of the sign and the ground. Any sign
mounted atop a cantilever, the top or roof of which is on the same plane as the roof of
the building, shall be deemed a roof sign and shall comply with all regulations herein
relating to roof signs.
(m) No permit shall be granted for the erection of a marquee sign the height of
any part of which exceeds 6'.
(n) Except where specifically provided to the contrary no business establishment
shall erect upon the premises occupied by such business more than one sign of the
following types of signs: (a) Pole sign; (b) Projecting Sign; (c) Roof Sign; (d)
Cantilever Sign; provided, however, that where more than one business is located in
a single building only one pole sign may be erected in front of such building
notwithstanding the fact that more than one business enterprise is operated upon such
premises.
(o) Where a pole sign or detached sign is so constructed that a person or child
may walk under a portion thereof, or a vehicle may drive under a portion thereof, such
portions of such signs must be at least nine feet (9') above grade. Pole signs and
detached signs must be constructed so as not to obstruct pedestrian or vehicular traffic
or constitute a hazard thereto.
14.9 Prohibited Signs. It shall be unlawful for any person to erect,
construct, or maintain within the City of West Miami any of the following signs:
(a) Sign erected, constructed or affixed in violation of the provisions of this
ordinance.
(b) Sign which fails to comply with the standards herein prescribed for the sign.
(c) Billboard sign; or any sign advertising goods or
services not sold or performed on the premises.
(d) snipe sign.
(e) Any sign not specifically provided for and
permitted by this ordinance.
(f) Sign which employs the word "Stop" or the word "Danger" as to imply the
necessity for stopping or the existence of danger, or which by other means makes such
implication.
(g) Sign constituting an imitation of or purporting to
imitate any official traffic signal or police caution device.
(h) Bus bench advertising signs.
(i) No illuminated sign shall face any residence; nor
shall any such sign cast illumination upon residential property.
14.10 Detached Signs.
(a) Except as otherwise provided herein no detached sign shall be permitted in
any zoning district of the city of West Miami other than a district zoned "C".
(b) No detached sign shall exceed 35 I in height or 50 square feet in calculated
area as determined by Section 14.2
(c) Detached signs shall be located so that the leading edge of the sign including
any of the supporting members thereof, shall be set back not less than 5 feet from any
lot line abutting Southwest 8th Street or Southwest 57th Avenue, and not less than 5
feet from any lot line abutting any other official right-of-way, and not less than 5 feet
from any side line or interior lots; provided, however, that no sign shall overhand any
public sidewalk. The minimum distance shall be determined by a line from the leading
edge of the sign, including any of the supporting members thereof, projected parallel to
the ground to the point at which such line intersects with a perpendicular plane created
by a projection of the property line.
(d) No detached sign shall be located in any shopping center where the front
building setback shall be less than 30' from the front property line.
(e) A detached sign may exceed 40 square feet in calculated area in connection
with a property having a frontage in excess of 50 lineal feet according to the following
scale:
Frontage in lineal feet Calculated area of sign
Up to 50' 50 square feet
Over 50' but not over 100' 50 Sq. Ft. plus 1 sq. ft. per 2 lineal ft. in excess of
50'
Over 100' but not over 300' 75 Sq. Ft. plus 1 sp. ft. per
2 lineal ft. in excess of 100'
Over 300' 265 Sq. Ft. plus 1 sq.ft. per
2 lineal ft. in excess of 300' up to 300 sq. ft.
(f) No detached sign shall exceed 300 square feet in calculated area.
(g) No more than one detached sign having an area in excess of 50 square feet
of area shall be placed in any location. Provided, however, a shopping center having a
frontage of 150 lineal feet or more may erect two signs in excess of 50 square feet of
calculated area, each of which shall conform to the above established scale.
(h) A detached sign exceeding 50 square feet of calculated area shall be
installed on the frontage upon which the area of the sign is calculated.
(i) In addition to the above signs, the Mayor may authorize the erection of
directional signs denoting entrance, exit, and par-king on the premises of the permittee
where the safety and convenience of the public will be served. Such directional signs
shall not exceed 20 square feet of calculated area, and shall contain no advertising
matter other than the name of the business at which the sign is located, which name
may be included on the sign in letters no larger than those used for other legend on the
sign.
14. 11 Removal of Sign upon Cessation of Business.
It shall be unlawful for any owner or permittee to fail or refuse to remove any sign, after
ten (10) days of the service of written notice from the Building Inspector so to do, which
advertises a business or product which has not been conducted or sold at the premises
where the sign is located for more than six (6) consecutive months prior to the date of
said notice from the Building Inspector. The maintenance of any such sign after the ten
(10) day period shall be deemed a nuisance and shall be abated as such, provided,
however, the decision of the Building Inspector may be reviewed by the Planning and
Zoning Board upon application filed in writing within such ten (10) day period.
14.12 Design and Construction.
(a) No permit shall be granted for the erection or construction of any sign unless
such sign shall be designed to resist wind pressure in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter 23 of the South Florida Building Code.
(b) No permit shall be granted for the erection or construction of any sign
containing wood or other combustible material where such sign is to be erected or
constructed in a business, commercial, or industrial zone of the City.
(c) No permit shall be granted for the erection or construction of any roof sign,
regardless of zone, if any part of said sign shall consist of combustible materials.
(d) No sign shall be erected or constructed except in accordance with the design
information filed with the Building Inspector and by use of materials as represented in
the application for permit to the exclusion of any other materials.
(e) No permit for a sign to be erected in a "C" Use Zoning District shall be issued
until application therefore containing sketch of prepared sign shall have been submitted
to and approved by the Planning and Zoning Board as to size, shape, color, and design
as they pertain to compatibility and suitability to the surrounding area. Any person
aggrieved by a decision of said Board may appeal same to the City Council in
accordance with the procedure for appealing from decisions of the Board on
applications for exceptions and variances, upon payment of the fees therein provided.
Times for appealing from the Board and times that the action of the Board and Council
shall become final shall be as provided in this Ordinance with reference to appeals from
exceptions and variances.
14.13 Electrical Signs.
(a) The construction, reconstruction, and maintenance of all signs employing the
use of electric current shall be in conformance with the applicable provisions of the
South Florida Building Code. No such sign shall be constructed, reconstructed,
maintained, or operated in the City of West Miami unless plans for and location of same
shall first have been approved by the Electrical Inspector of the Building Department
and shall have been inspected and approved by him after construction or
reconstruction.
(b) No electric or neon sign shall be located so as to constitute a menace to life
or property, and no neon sign shall be constructed or reconstructed so that any portion
of the neon shall be closer to the ground than 9'.
(c) Electrical signs shall be designed and constructed to prevent the trapping of
rainwater and the accumulation of moisture around or upon any conductor, sockets, or
other electrical equipment.
14.14 The following signs may be erected or constructed without a permit but in
accordance with the structural and safety requirements of the Building Code.
(a) Official traffic signs or sign structures and provisional warning signs or sign
structures, when erected or required to be erected by a governmental agency and
temporary signs indicating danger.
(b) Changing of the copy on a bulletin board, poster board, display encasement,
or marquee.
(c) Temporary non-illuminated signs, not to exceed size provided for herein,
advertising real estate for sale or lease or announcing contemplated improvements of
real estate, and located on the premises, one such sign for each street frontage.
(d) Temporary non-illuminated signs not to exceed size provided for herein,
erected in connection with new construction work and displayed on the premises during
such time as the actual construction work is in progress, one such sign for each street
frontage.
(e) Non-illuminated sign, not exceeding ten square feet in area with letters not
exceeding eight inches in height, painted, stamped, perforated, or stitched on the
surface area of an awning, canopy, roller curtain, or umbrella.
(f) Temporary signs inside a store window advertising merchandise for sale on
the premises.
(g) Sign on a truck, bus, or other vehicle, while in use in the normal course of a
business. This section should not be interpreted to permit parking of a vehicle to which
signs are attached in a district where such signs are not permitted.
14.15 Temporary Signs.
(a) The Mayor, upon application, may issue temporary permits for the following
signs and displays for a period of not exceeding 30 days, when in his opinion, the use of
such signs and displays would be in the public interest and would not result in damage
to private property:
(1) Signs advertising a special civic or cultural event such as a fair or
exposition, play, concert or meeting, sponsored by a governmental or charitable
organization.
(2) Special decorative displays used for holidays, public demonstrations,
or promotion of none-partisan civic purposes.
(3) Special sales promotion displays in a district where such sales are
permitted, including displays incidental to the opening of a new business.
(b) Pennants, banners, streamers, and all other fluttering' spinning or similar type
signs and advertising devices are prohibited except for national flags and flags of
political subdivisions of the United States, and except for flags of bona fide civic,
charitable, fraternal, and welfare organizations, and except during nationally recognized
holiday periods, pennants, banners,, streamers, and other fluttering, spinning, or similar
type advertising devices pertaining to said holiday periods may be displayed on a
temporary permit basis as provided above in this article.
14.16 (86-10) Bus Shelter Signs and Advertising.
When authorized by franchise agreement entered into by the City and
franchisee, a franchisee is permitted upon obtaining a building permit, the right to
construct, erect, install, repair and maintain shelters at bus stop locations on land
owned or leased by the City or over which the City has obtained easements or use
rights.
The City, upon resolution of the City Council, may authorize the City Manager to
execute a franchise agreement upon the behalf of the City, upon terms, conditions and
safeguards imposed by the City Council after public hearing. Such terms, conditions
and safeguards shall include, but not be limited to:
1. Designation and number of locations
2. Term of franchisee
3. Duties and obligations of franchisee
4. Rights of City to require removal of any advertising material
which it believes to be offensive, not suitable or in disrepair.
5. Hold harmless agreement indemnifying City from any and all
claims of whatsoever kind and nature including claims or
actions alleging negligence on behalf of the City.
6. Requirement of compliance with all applicable rules,
regulations, code, statutes and ordinances of every
governmental agency, including Federal, State, County and City
of West Miami, Florida
7. Liability insurance
8. Maintenance and cleaning
9. Payment of franchise fees
10. Community service
11. Unilateral cancellation right of City (86-10)
Section 14.17 Bus Bench Signs and Advertising
When authorized by franchise agreement entered into by the City and franchisee, a
franchisee is permitted upon obtaining a permit, the right to construct, erect, install,
repair and maintain bus benches at public bus stop locations on land owned or leased
by the City or over which the City has obtained easements or use rights, including public
right-of-way.
The City, upon resolution of the City Commission, may authorize the City
Manager to execute a franchise agreement upon the behalf of the City, upon terms,
conditions and safeguards imposed by the City Commission after public hearing. Such
terms, conditions and safeguards shall include, but not be limited to:
1. Designation and number of locations
2. Term of franchise
3. Duties and obligations of franchisee
4. Rights of City to require removal of any advertising material
which it believes to be offensive, not suitable or in disrepair.
5. Hold harmless agreement indemnifying City from any and all
claims of whatsoever kind and nature including claims or
actions alleging negligence on behalf of the City.
6. Requirement of compliance with all applicable rules,
regulations, code, statutes and ordinances of every
governmental agency, including Federal, State, County and City
of West Miami, Florida
7. Public liability insurance
8. Right of City to approve size of advertising panel, bench design
and materials used in construction of benches, including antigraffiti
materials.
9. Maintenance and cleaning, including provisions for graffiti
removal (within 24 hours of notification).
10. Immediate protection or removal of hazardous benches upon
notification.
11. Payment of franchise fees
12. Community service
13. Unilateral cancellation right of City
Section 15. BUILDING PERMITS
15.1 Building permits shall be issued by the City of West Miami only after
approval of the building plan and layout by the Plumbing Inspector, Electrical Inspector
and finally by the Building Official, who shall be satisfied that the proposed building, or
use is in conformity with the ordinances of the City of West Miami, Metropolitan Dade
County and the Laws of the State of Florida.
15.2 Every application for a permit to erect, add to or materially alter a
building or structure shall be accompanied by two sets of detailed plans and
specifications. Where the value of such erection, alteration or addition shall exceed Ten
Thousand Dollars ($10,000.00), the plans and specifications shall bear the seal of a
Florida Registered Architect and/or Registered Engineer. A sketch of a lot survey by a
Florida Registered Surveyor shall accompany each application except where proposed
construction will not extend beyond the walls of an existing building. Where electrical
and/or plumbing plans are required for construction, two (2) additional sets of plans
must be furnished by applicant. Notwithstanding the foregoing, where the building
alteration or addition shall be of such nature that in the opinion of the City Engineer or
City Building officials the Public Health or Safety requires that plans and specifications
therefore bear the seal of a Florida Registered Architect and/or Registered Engineer,
such seal shall be required without regard to the value of the proposed building
alteration or addition.
15.3 All building permits are void if construction has not been commenced
within nine (9) months after issuance or if no active work or labor takes place for a
period of nine (9) months except in the event of strikes, war, flood, hurricane, or other
acts of God. However, the person holding such permit may apply within seven (7) days
prior to the expiration thereof to the City of West Miami. for an extension for a period not
to exceed ninety (90) days.
15.4 Where a structure is to be erected, altered or added to in a "C" , "A" or
"R-3" Use District, and where the value of erection, alteration or addition will exceed
Five Hundred Dollars ($500.00), all construction shall be performed by a Licensed
Building Contractor.
15.5 Variance permits may be applied for as provided by ordinance.
15.6 No construction shall be commenced until the Building Permit is issued.
Section 16. ADMINISTRATION
16.1 It shall be the duty of the Mayor to enforce this ordinance, issue
necessary permits and establish and collect necessary fees, in conjunction with the
Building, Plumbing and Electrical Codes applicable in the City of West Miami.
Section 17. CERTIFICATE OF OCCUPANCY
17.1 A Certificate of Occupancy, either for the whole or a part of' a new
building or for alteration of an existing building, shall be issued by the Building Official
after notification by owner or his agent that such building or part shall have been
completed in conformity with the provisions of this Ordinance, which includes the final
clean-up, painting of exterior wall, and repair of damaged City property. A Certificate of
Occupancy when issued pursuant to the foregoing provisions shall include all off-street
parking areas required by this Ordinance. After a Certificate of Occupancy has been
issued including off-street parking areas therein, it shall be unlawful to sever the legal
title and ownership of the premises, including off'-street parking areas for which the
Certificate of occupancy was issued.
17.2 A Certificate of Occupancy for the use or occupancy of vacant lands,
or for a change in the use of the lands, or for a change in the use of an existing building,
shall be applied for and issued to owner of the premises before any such land or
building shall be occupied or used or changed in use, and such certificate shall be
issued after application has been made, provided such proposed use is in conformity
with this ordinance and the structure to be occupied conforms to the Building Code.
17.3 No vacant land shall be occupied or used, and no structure hereafter
erected, constructed, reconstructed or structurally altered shall be used or changed in
use until a Certificate of Occupancy shall have been issued by the City Administration.
Section 18. CITY PLANNING AND ZONING BOARD
18.1.(91-03) The City Commission of the City of West Miami shall appoint, by not
less than a majority vote, a Planning and Zoning Board consisting of five (5) members,
one of whom will be appointed for a term ending June 30, 1958, two of whom will be
appointed for a term ending June 30, 1959, and two of whom will be appointed for a
term ending June 30, 1960, and thereafter each member shall be appointed for a term
of three (3) years. The City Commission shall appoint by not less than a majority vote
an alternate member of the Board for a term of three (3) years to serve as a member of
the Board in absence of any member, who shall receive the same compensation per
meeting as a regular member if required to attend the meeting of the Board whether
serving in absence of any member or not. The appointment of any member and
alternate member of the Board may be terminated prior to the expiration of a member's
term upon written charges filed by the Mayor or any member of the City Commission for
good cause shown, including misfeasance, malfeasance, nonfeasance or willful
nonattendance at a meeting properly called; said charges shall be heard by the City
Commission at the next meeting after the filing of the charges with the City Clerk, and
shall require a three fifths (3/5) vote of the entire Commission to dismiss a member or
alternate.
(91-03)18.2 Vacancies in the board shall be filled in the same manner as original
appointments, provided, however, that any such vacancies, when filled, shall be for the
term only of the board member whose position is vacant.
18.3 Members of the board shall not hold any other office or any other position
under the City government.
18.4 Members of the Board shall receive compensation of Fifteen Dollars ($15.00)
per meeting attended, with the maximum of Thirty Dollars ($30.00) for any one calendar
month. If the term of any member is terminated for good cause shown as provided in
Section 18.1 hereof, such member shall not be entitled to any compensation for the
period following the occurrence of the grounds for dismissal.
18.5 The board shall meet and organize within fifteen
(15) days after its appointment, and shall, from its members, elect a Chairman and Vice-
Chairman, whose term shall expire on July 1 next following.
18.6 The City Engineer shall serve as Chief Engineer of the City Planning Board
and it shall be his duty to make recommendations designed to bring all the engineering
works of the City into harmony as parts of one Comprehensive Plan. The board shall
have power to call upon any branch of the City government at any time for information
and advice, which, in the opinion of the board, will aid in the efficiency of its work, and it
shall be the duty of each branch of the City government to furnish such information and
advice promptly.
18.7(87-15) It shall be the duty of the Board to investigate and recommend to the
City Council such changes in the boundaries of the various use districts,, zoning
regulations and restrictions as may be deemed appropriate by the Board. No changes
in the various use districts, zoning regulations or restrictions shall be adopted by the city
council except by the favorable vote of four-fifths (4/5) of the entire City Council
where a protest against such change is signed by the owners of twenty percent (20%)
or more, either of the area of the lots included in such proposed change, or those within
500 feet of the boundaries of the property included in such proposed change.
(87-15)
18.7-1 (87-16) All matters referred to the Board for investigation and
recommendation to the City , shall be made by the Board to the City no later than sixty
(60) days from such referral, unless the time is extended by the City , otherwise, the
matter shall be considered by the City without recommendation of the Board. (87-16)
18.7-2 (90-6) The City Commission shall have the sole authority to grant changes of
Use Districts or re-zoning of property in 'Use Districts, hereinafter referred to as "rezoning".
18.7-3 (a) All applications for re-zoning involving a change in use districts as above
provided, shall be filed with the City Clerk, accompanied by a filing fee of $50.00 and a
cash deposit in an amount to be determined by the City Clerk for costs and expenses of
Court Reporter's attendance fee and charges for the preparation of transcript, and costs
and expenses of publication of notices and mailing of notices to property owners
required by the Zoning Ordinances of the City. The City Clerk shall thereupon give
notice of hearing before the Planning and Zoning Board, as set forth in Paragraph 18.7
hereof.
(b) At the time and place set-forth in the notice of hearing the Board shall
conduct a hearing which shall be open to the public. The Board shall receive testimony
and evidence of both proponents and opponents of the application. The Board shall not
be bound by strict rules of evidence.
(c)All proceedings shall be reported by a competent court reporter who shall
thereafter transcribe his/her notes of the proceedings and file the original with the City
Clerk under the reporter's certificate. Upon receipt of the transcript the City Clerk shall
pay from the deposit of the applicant the charges of the Court Reporter for attendance
and transcript and all costs of publications and mailing of notices to property owners as
required by this ordinance, and shall remit the balance if any, to the applicant; and if the
said charges and expenses shall exceed the deposit the City Clerk shall thereupon
obtain the difference from the applicant and the matter shall not be set for hearing
before the Commission until such difference is paid by the applicant.
(d)The Board shall promptly render its recommendations upon such application to
the City Commission either by dictating same to the Reporter at the close of the
hearing, or by separate written report prepared following the meeting. In all events such
report of recommendations shall be filed with the City Clerk no later than one week
following the date of hearing on the application or last continuance thereof, and the
Clerk shall thereupon furnish a copy to the applicant. The report shall include findings
of fact and law made by the Board.
(e)The City Clerk shall place upon the meeting agenda of the City Commission no
later than the second meeting following filing of the report of the Board as an item of
"old business" consideration of the application in question. Notice in writing of such
meeting shall be given the applicant and owners of property within 500' of the property
in question, and such notice shall recite whether Board recommends approval or denial
of the application.
(f)At such Commission meeting the Commission shall consider the
recommendations of the Board and shall hear arguments of both proponents and
opponents of the application upon the record of the proceedings before the Planning
and Zoning Board. No new evidence or testimony will be permitted or taken at the
hearing before the Commission. After all argument have been heard and after no
further continuance to the meetings, if any, the Commission shall render its decision by
vote upon resolution to approve or deny the application.
(g)No application for re-zoning shall be granted by the Commission 'unless such
application be in conformity and consistent with the adopted Comprehensive Plan of the
City.18.8 It shall be the further duty of the board to hear applications for exceptions and
variances to any provision of the zoning ordinance of the City of West Miami as from
time to time amended, hereinafter referred to as "variances". The board may grant such
exceptions and variances from the terms of the zoning ordinances as will not be
contrary to the public interest, where, owing to special conditions, a literal enforcement
of the provisions of the ordinance will result in unnecessary hardship, provided that as
used in this ordinance the term variances shall not include changes or re-zoning of use
districts, hereinafter referred to as "re-zoning".
18.9All applications for such variances shall be filed with the City Clerk,
accompanied by a filing fee of $50.00. In addition, the applicant shall pay all expenses
and costs for publication of notices and mailing of notices required by the Zoning
